RESOURCES

current and past projects, and other resources

MCQLL Toolkits and software

Here are some of the pieces of software written by MCQLL members:

  • PolyglotDB
  • The Montreal Forced Aligner
  • SpeechCorpusTools
  • AutoVOT
  • Generalized Chart Parser

Toolkits and software we use

Some of our past projects have extensively used the following toolkits/programs:

  • Kaldi
  • HTK
  • Praat
  • AMDTK

Programming languages

Most existing lab projects are written in Python and Julia. Research tasks also often involve basic scripting in Bash and Praat. Lab members also have interest in Scheme and Haskell.

Useful Courses

The following courses have been helpful for past projects, and provide a solid background for computational linguistics more generally:

  • Ling 445
  • Ling 330
  • Ling 360
  • Ling 371
  • Comp 550
  • Comp 551
  • Comp 424
  • Comp 330
  • Comp 302
  • Comp 206

Computational linguistics conferences

  • Association for Computational Linguistics
  • Interspeech
  • International Conference on Computational Linguistics (COLING)
  • Conference on Empirical Methods in Natural Language Processing
